output.conclusion: This course provided a foundational understanding of machine learning concepts and techniques. You are now equipped to explore more advanced topics and apply these skills to real-world problems.
output.introduction: Welcome to Machine Learning Fundamentals! This course is designed for individuals with an intermediate understanding of programming and mathematics who are eager to delve into the world of machine learning. We will cover essential concepts, algorithms, and practical applications.

chapters.description: What is Machine Learning? Types of Machine Learning (Supervised, Unsupervised, Reinforcement). Applications of Machine Learning.
Features, Labels, Models, Training, Testing, Evaluation Metrics.
Data Collection, Data Preprocessing, Model Selection, Training, Evaluation, Deployment.
Handling Missing Values, Feature Scaling (Normalization, Standardization).
Removing Duplicates, Handling Outliers, Correcting Inconsistent Data.
Creating New Features, Feature Selection (Filter, Wrapper, Embedded methods).
Simple Linear Regression, Multiple Linear Regression, Model Evaluation (R-squared, MSE).
Binary Classification, Sigmoid Function, Model Evaluation (Accuracy, Precision, Recall, F1-score).
Bias-Variance Tradeoff, Overfitting, Underfitting, Regularization (L1, L2).
Classification using KNN, Distance Metrics (Euclidean, Manhattan), Choosing the optimal K.
Linear SVM, Kernel SVM (RBF, Polynomial), Hyperparameter Tuning.
Decision Tree Algorithm, Entropy, Information Gain, Tree Pruning.
Principal Component Analysis (PCA), t-distributed Stochastic Neighbor Embedding (t-SNE).
Anomaly Detection, Customer Segmentation, Recommendation Systems.
Cross-Validation (K-Fold, Stratified K-Fold), Confusion Matrix, ROC Curve.
Grid Search, Random Search, Bayesian Optimization.
Saving and Loading Models, Introduction to Model Serving.
